title: White House Calls Republican Budget Pact Offer ‘A Big Step Back’
description: The budget offer made by House Speaker Kevin McCarthy’s team on May 19 was “a big step back” and contained a set of extreme partisan demands that could never pass both Houses of Congress, White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre said.

title: Sudan’s Warring Sides Agree to Cease-Fire in US-Saudi Diplomacy
description: Saudi Arabia and the US said Sudan’s warring sides agreed on a seven-day cease-fire starting Monday to allow the distribution of humanitarian aid and restoration of essential services.

title: Labour Urges Inquiry Into Whether Braverman Broke Rules
description: The Labour Party called for an ethics inquiry into Home Secretary Suella Braverman, after a newspaper report that she sought civil servants’ help to deal with the fallout from a speeding ticket last year.

title: George Santos Names Campaign Treasurer After Appointing Himself
description: Representative George Santos’s campaign hired another treasurer after the New York Republican appointed himself to the post on Friday.

title: AMLO Rail Grab Could Hit Market Confidence, Business Group Says
description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s move to seize part of a rail line could damage investor confidence in the country, a major business lobby said Saturday.

title: Braverman Asked Civil Servants to Help With Speeding Fine: Times
description: UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman asked civil servants to help her avoid a speeding fine and penalty points on her driving license, the Times of London reported.

title: Georgia President Boycotts Local Airline Over Flights to Russia
description: Georgia’s President Salome Zourabichvili said she will not use the services of the privately owned Georgian Airways following the carrier’s decision to resume commercial flights to Russia.

title: US Debt-Limit Negotiators Hold Off on Renewed Meetings Saturday
description: US debt-limit negotiators aren’t planning to meet on Saturday, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as President Joe Biden signals he remains confident the government can avoid a catastrophic default.

title: Sinn Fein Set for N.Ireland Election Win, Adds Pressure on DUP
description: Sinn Fein is on course to become the biggest party in Northern Ireland’s local government for the first time ever, a historic victory that will heap pressure on the Democratic Unionist Party to end its Brexit-linked boycott of the region’s power-sharing government.

title: Tanzania Wraps Up $40 Billion LNG Project Talks; Key Deals Soon
description: Tanzania has wrapped up negotiations with an international energy consortium for a long-delayed $40 billion liquefied natural gas export project, paving the way for final agreements to be signed in the coming weeks.

title: Ghana’s Public Debt Falls by a Fourth on External Obligations
description: Ghana’s public debt declined by a quarter at the end of December from the previous month as the nation’s external obligations decreased.

title: Italian Leader Meloni to Leave G-7 Early to Deal With Floods
description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni will leave the Group of Seven summit in Japan a day early to help the response to devastating floods, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Sinn Fein Remains on Course to Be Largest Party in Northern Ireland Councils
description: Sinn Fein remains on course to become the largest party in councils in Northern Ireland as counting continues in the local government elections.

title: A Dangerous World Looms Over G-7 Summit: Weekend Reads
description: Group of Seven leaders began their summit in the Japanese city of Hiroshima in a somber mood over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and rising tensions with China.

title: Zelenskiy’s Surprise G-7 Stop Unnerves Critical Brazilian Leader
description: The unannounced attendance of Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy at the G-7 summit has unnerved the Brazilian delegation, which now feels pressure to accept an invitation for a face-to-face meeting with President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, according to Brazilian officials.

title: Polish Ruling Party Slips in Opinion Polls Despite Spending Plan
description: Poland’s ruling Law & Justice party is losing support, opinion polls show, a sign that its recent proposals to increase social spending are failing so far to resonate with the public.

title: Thai Election Winner Confident of Senators’ Support in PM Vote
description: Thailand’s leading pro-democracy party, which swept Sunday’s election, is confident its coalition will win over senators’ prime ministerial votes for its leader Pita Limjaroenrat.

title: Taiwan’s Tsai Puts China, Chip Power Center-Stage in Final Year
description: Taiwan’s President Tsai Ing-wen said cross-strait security and reinforcing the island’s position in the global supply chain will be key priorities for her final year in office, as she lays a path for her deputy to succeed her.

title: Ukraine Recap: Zelenskiy Arrives at G-7; Drone Attack on Kyiv
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy arrived at the Group of Seven summit in Hiroshima, Japan, where he intends to speak directly to other world leaders from countries like Brazil and India, which have taken a more neutral stance over Russia’s invasion.

title: China to Boycott G-20 Meet in Kashmir, Calls it Disputed Region
description: China has said it will not attend next week’s G-20 tourism group meeting scheduled to take place in India’s Himalayan state of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Biden Confident US Will Avoid Default Amid Tense Debt Talks
description: President Joe Biden downplayed fresh concerns that tensions in US debt-limit negotiations could lead to a catastrophic US default, saying Republicans and Democrats could still reach an agreement.

title: G-7 Leaders Agree to Set Up ‘Hiroshima Process’ to Govern AI
description: Leaders of the Group of Seven countries agreed on the need for governance in accordance with G-7 values in the field of generative AI, expressing concern about the disruptive potential of rapidly expanding technologies.

title: G-7 Seeks Stable China Ties While ‘De-risking,’ Communique Says
description: Group of Seven leaders said they wanted “constructive and stable” relations with China even as they pushed ahead with steps to reduce dependence on Beijing for critical supply chains, according to a copy of the final communique seen by Bloomberg.

title: China Blasts G-7’s New Joint Effort Against Economic Coercion
description: China responded to the Group of Seven nations’ new joint mechanism to counter economic coercion, accusing them of manipulation and interference in its internal affairs.

title: Low-Income Tenants Lack Options as Mobile Home Parks Are Razed
description: PHOENIX (AP) — Alondra Ruiz Vazquez and her husband were comfortable in Periwinkle Mobile Home Park for a decade, feeling lucky to own their mobile home and pay about $450 a month for their lot in a city with spiraling rents.

title: Record UK Migration Surge Set to Expose Government Divisions
description: Data confirming a record surge in migration into the UK is expected to lay bare splits in the ruling Conservative Party and highlight the economy’s urgent demand for new workers.

title: Australia’s Ruling Party Retains Poll Lead on First Anniversary
description: Australia’s ruling Labor party maintained its election-winning lead in a new opinion poll conducted to mark the center-left government’s one-year anniversary since taking office.

title: Jokowi Dismisses Tech Minister Detained in Corruption Probe
description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo dismissed Johnny Plate as communication and information technology minister after he was detained in a probe into alleged corruption.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy Treks to G-7 to See the Other Invited Guests
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy lands in Japan on Saturday afternoon with a key objective: To speak in person with leaders from countries like Brazil and India who have taken a more neutral stance over Russia’s invasion.

title: G-7 Latest: Zelenskiy Set to Arrive, China Policies in Focus
description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set make a high-stakes visit to the Group of Seven summit, seeking to win support from middle powers such as Brazil and India while building on the backing of the US and its allies as Ukraine readies a counter-offensive to Russia’s invasion.
